channel.title: [SUGGESTION] Competitions board
channel.description:
I think that a board created specifically for competitions would allow people to show-off their creative talents and would allow other people to learn from, generally, better and more efficient code.
In this board we could have sub-sections, such as coding-competitions (I don't know whether splitting it into multiple language boards would be more cluttered), graphics competitions, and other such nonsense.
So post what you think!
(Sorry about the poll btw, thought it'd piss some people off so I did it)

item.title: [SUGGESTION] Competitions board
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

So what are the advantages to having a competitions board over the current setup? Give me a few good reasons and I will set it up.

Some other admin will do the job for you as always, nothing to worry about.

Read full topic

item.title: [SUGGESTION] Competitions board
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

We could have people with special powers specifically moderate the competition boards, as well as set up new competitions. They could also be the judges for the final products. Inside the board, the stickies could possibly the rules and current judgements of a competition, and each of the topic posts would be a new user showing off their work. I think keeping it all in its own board makes it neater and easier to manage.

Read full topic

item.title: [SUGGESTION] Competitions board
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Idea sounds like fun. Separate boards would make it easier to post competitions + manage competitions, imo. And I think judging should be done both in an automated way (assuming frank_ was talking about the performance the program sustains to), and in a judge panel way. This way, if the two programs are very close in performance, the judges then judge the neatness of the code, as well as smart or stupid choices within the code.

Read full topic
